data.title: Chico Marx
data.text:
AKA Leonard Marx

Born: 22-Mar-1887

Birthplace: New York City

Died: 11-Oct-1961

Location of death: Los Angeles, CA

Cause of death: Heart Failure

Remains: Buried, Forest Lawn Memorial Park Cemetery, Glendale, CA

Gender: Male

Religion: Jewish

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Actor

Nationality: United States

Executive summary: An Italian con-man of a Marx Brother

Father: Sam Marx (b. 1861, d. 10-May-1933)

Mother: Minnie Marx

Brother: Groucho Marx (actor)

Brother: Harpo Marx (actor)

Brother: Zeppo Marx (actor)

Brother: Gummo Marx (actor)

Wife: Betty Carp (div., one daughter)

Wife: Mary De Vithas (m. 1958, until his death)

Daughter: Maxine Marx (b. 1918 to Betty Carp)

Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

Marx Brothers

Risk Factors: Gambling

FILMOGRAPHY AS ACTOR

The Story of Mankind (8-Nov-1957) · Monk

Love Happy (12-Oct-1949) · Faustino

A Night in Casablanca (10-May-1946) · Corbaccio

The Big Store (20-Jun-1941)

Go West (6-Dec-1940) · Joe Panello

At the Circus (20-Oct-1939) · Antonio

Room Service (30-Sep-1938) · Harry Binelli

A Day at the Races (11-Jun-1937) · Tony

A Night at the Opera (15-Nov-1935) · Fiorello

Duck Soup (17-Nov-1933) · Chicolini

Horse Feathers (10-Aug-1932) · Baravelli

Monkey Business (19-Sep-1931) · Chico

Animal Crackers (28-Aug-1930) · Signor Emanuel Ravelli

The Cocoanuts (3-May-1929)
